sub_topic: Show that every group of order pq, where p and q are distinct primes, is either cyclic or isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of orders p and q.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 35. Determine whether G is isomorphic to a cyclic group or to the direct product of two cyclic groups. If so, give the orders of the cyclic groups. If not, explain why.
message_2:
Since the order of G is 35, we know that |G| = 35 = 5 * 7, where 5 and 7 are prime numbers. According to the Fundamental Theorem of Finite Abelian Groups, a group of order p * q, where p and q are distinct prime numbers, is isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups of orders p and q.

Therefore, G is isomorphic to the direct product of two cyclic groups, one of order 5 and the other of order 7.
